ReportText: Exam: CHEST, 2 VIEWS HISTORY: Cough. TECHNICAL FACTORS: Frontal and lateral views of the chest were reviewed. COMPARISON: None. FINDINGS: Pericardial mediastinal silhouette is within normal limits. There is central perihilar opacity with peribronchial cuffing. No focal airspace consolidation or effusion. No osseous abnormality. No radiopaque foreign body is identified. CONCLUSION: 1. Findings consistent with viral or small airways disease. No focal pneumonia. Thank you for the opportunity to provide your interpretation.
